author: Natalia Drozdiak, Samy Adghirni, Daryna Krasnolutska, Michael Nienaber
description: European leaders sought to buy time for Ukraine to work out a new ceasefire framework with Russia after the Trump administration set a one-week deadline to agree to terms that Kyiv and its allies rejected as an unacceptable giveaway to Moscow.
title: Europe Pushes for More Time After US Sets Ukraine Deal Deadline

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Joe Sobczyk
description: Both men move past the harsh words of the campaign.
title: Trump and Mamdani Find Common Ground in Their Goals For NYC

author: Jen Judson
description: RTX Corp. and Israeli defense firm Rafael have won a $1.25 billion contract to build surface-to-air missiles for Israel’s Iron Dome air-defense system at a new plant in Arkansas, the joint venture announced.
title: RTX Joint Venture Wins Contract to Make Iron Dome Missiles in US

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Katia Porzecanski
description: President Donald Trump said he wants to see Zohran Mamdani succeed, saying after a highly anticipated sitdown that he’d “feel very comfortable” living in a New York run by the mayor-elect and that he doesn’t anticipate cutting off funding for the country’s most populous city.
title: Trump Says He’d ‘Feel Very Comfortable’ in Mamdani’s NYC

author: Mark Chediak
description: President Donald Trump said he talked about the need for New York utility Consolidated Edison Inc. to lower rates during a meeting with New York Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani at the White House.
title: Trump Calls on New York’s Con Ed to Cut Rates in Meeting With Mamdani

author: Courtney McBride, Natalia Drozdiak
description: The Trump administration has threatened to suspend aid to Ukraine unless its government accepts a peace framework by Thanksgiving. The loss of intelligence sharing by the US could prove more devastating than a cutoff of weapons.
title: Cutoff of US Intelligence Could Harm Ukraine More Than Arms Halt

author: John Harney
description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth met a top Nigerian security official to reinforce the Trump administration’s claim that Christians in the West African country have been singled out for “horrific violence.”
title: Hegseth Pursues Trump Persecution Claim With Nigerian Official

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and President Donald Trump discussed Ukraine in a phone call Friday, a German government spokesman said, as the US steps up pressure for a peace deal with Russia.
title: Germany Says Merz, Trump Discussed Ukraine Steps in Phone Call

author: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard
description: US officials are having early discussions on whether to let Nvidia Corp. sell its H200 artificial intelligence chips to China, according to people familiar with the matter, a contentious potential move that would mark a major win for the world’s most valuable company.
title: Trump Team Internally Floats Idea of Selling Nvidia H200 Chips to China

author: Katrina Manson
description: US military is trying shotguns as last-ditch defense against drone attacks.
title: Florida Gifts Confiscated Chinese Drones to Military for Target Practice

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s Foreign Affairs Ministry sent a rare note of protest to Washington after the new US ambassador chided President Gabriel Boric for his public criticism of US President Donald Trump.
title: Chile Government Fires Back at Trump Diplomat After Critique

author: David Voreacos
description: Pras Michel, a Grammy-winning rapper turned political influencer, was sentenced to 14 years in prison for conspiring to wage a back-channel lobbying campaign to end US probes of fugitive Malaysian tycoon Jho Low and other crimes.
title: Rapper Michel Gets 14 Years for Illegally Aiding 1MDB’s Jho Low

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Chile leftist presidential candidate Jeannette Jara reshuffled her campaign team, bringing in former ministers, social media influencers and athletes as she competes as an underdog before next month’s runoff.
title: Chile Leftist Presidential Candidate Jeannette Jara Revamps Campaign Leadership

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he hopes to secure a solution by Jan. 30 for an impending surge in health insurance premiums for millions of Americans, the first timeline he has publicly offered for what he has pitched as an alternative to the Affordable Care Act.
title: Trump Says He Wants Alternate Health Care Plan ‘Done’ by Jan. 30

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro called for a power-sharing deal between Venezuela’s government and opposition as a peaceful way out of the nation’s crisis.
title: Colombian President Petro Backs Power Sharing Deal for Venezuela

author: Andrea Palasciano, Michael Nienaber
description: The UK has rebuffed the European Union’s request that it pay €2 billion ($2.3 billion) to join the bloc’s massive defense fund, putting pressure on leaders to find a last-minute deal at a Group of 20 meeting this weekend.
title: UK Shuns EU’s €2 Billion Demand to Join Key Defense Fund

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The Group of 20 called for greater protection of critical minerals from unilateral trade actions, in a veiled reference to China’s sweeping export curbs unleashed during Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: G-20 Calls to Shield Critical Minerals From Sweeping Trade Curbs

author: Katherine Griffiths
description: A UK politician will ask the University of Oxford’s leader about its handling of sexual harassment complaints, after a Bloomberg investigation found the institution had repeatedly been slow to act against male academics accused of sexual misconduct and inappropriate behavior. The report has also prompted the British Academy to open a probe into one of its members.
title: Oxford MP to Question University’s Leader Over Harassment Record

author: Myles Miller
description: Rain slicked the granite at the New York City Police Memorial near the World Financial Center as Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani stood beside Police Commissioner Jessica Tisch, speaking quietly with officers. It was the first public appearance since his election with the commissioner who will remain in charge of the 178-year-old police force.
title: Mamdani Plan to Revamp Policing Faces Early Test Inside the NYPD

author: Daniel Carvalho, Augusta Saraiva, Dayanne Sousa
description: From the minute Donald Trump slapped tariffs on Brazil, President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva bet the US leader was going all-in on a weak hand. The wager paid off Thursday, when Trump limped away from the battle.
title: Lula Stares Down Trump and Scores Tariff Victory for Brazil

author: Marton Eder
description: Russian energy giant Lukoil PJSC dissolved the supervisory board of its international business, the latest sign of how US sanctions — the first of which begin on Friday — are affecting the firm.
title: Lukoil Dissolves International Board as Sanctions Get Underway

author: Will Standring
description: Reform UK’s former leader in Wales was sentenced to 10 and-a-half years in prison after pleading guilty to making pro-Russian statements for cash, raising uncomfortable questions for Nigel Farage and his poll-topping-party.
title: Ex-Farage Ally Gets 10.5 Years in Jail for Taking Pro-Russian Bribes

author: Swati Gupta
description: India implemented overhauled labor laws that aim to attract investments and make it easier for companies to do business in the South Asian nation. according to a statement form the labor ministry.
title: India Implements Overhauled Labor Laws to Attract More Investors

author: Emele Onu, Nduka Orjinmo
description: Another group of schoolchildren has been kidnapped in northern Nigeria, in the second such incident this week in the West African nation where attacks by militants have displaced thousands of people.
title: Nigeria Suffers Second Kidnapping of Schoolchildren in a Week

author: Ben Sills, Arne Delfs
description: Kyiv’s biggest European allies lined up with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to reject key elements of a US-Russian plan to end the war in Ukraine that would mean sweeping concessions to Vladimir Putin.
title: Ukraine, European Allies Reject Key Parts of US-Russia Plan

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Caitlin Reilly
description: President Donald Trump and Republican lawmakers are grasping for ideas on a new party-line package aimed at blunting criticism of rising health care and other costs of living, as spiking premiums bedevil the party and affordability becomes the defining issue of next year’s pivotal midterm elections.
title: GOP Awaits Trump Direction on Health Care as Subsidy Spike Looms

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Lars Klingbeil’s attempt to reset German ties with China has done little more than showcase the weakness of Europe’s biggest economy in engaging with its Asian counterpart.
title: Germany Keeps Doors Open in China But Has Nothing to Show for It

author: Daniel Hornak
description: The European Commission opened legal proceedings against Slovakia over a constitutional amendment claiming national law prevails over the bloc’s rules, escalating tensions between Brussels and Robert Fico’s government.
title: EU Opens Case Against Slovakia Over Primacy of Law

author: Peter Chapman, Samuel Stolton
description: The European Union fired a warning shot to the Italian government over its attempts to thwart UniCredit SpA’s aborted takeover of Banco BPM SpA amid a power struggle between Brussels and Rome over the bloc’s drive for banking consolidation.
title: EU Warns Italy Over Powers That Foiled UniCredit-Banco BPM Deal

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Martin Ritchie, Colum Murphy
description: Japan will likely lean more heavily on the US and its allies if China escalates economic pressure, as Tokyo seeks to navigate the fallout from Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s remarks linking Taiwan’s security to its own.
title: Japan Set to Lean on US Allies for Support If China Escalates

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: The group’s future is uncertain after the US president boycotted the summit in South Africa.
title: Dropping Out One By One, G-20 Is Now a Husk in Trump Era

author: Piotr Skolimowski
description: This is the 28-point peace plan drawn up by US officials for ending Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: Read the Full Text of the US-Russia 28-Point Plan for Peace in Ukraine

author: Arne Delfs, Alberto Nardelli, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz canceled his agenda Friday in order to hold an urgent call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and other European leaders about a US-Russian plan to end the war in Ukraine that would mean sweeping concessions to Vladimir Putin.
title: European Leaders to Hold Call With Zelenskiy on US-Russian Plan

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy told lawmakers that he’ll stand by his powerful chief of staff despite mounting pressure to oust him in response to a growing corruption scandal.
title: Zelenskiy Stands by Chief of Staff as Graft Accusations Grow

author: Craig Stirling, Mark Schroers
description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said the region’s constant prevarication over measures to boost its economy just can’t continue with yet more years of lost prosperity.
title: Lagarde Urges Europe to Spur Growth or Be Held ‘Irresponsible’

author: Taonga Mitimingi
description: Zambia initiated a $1.4 billion overhaul of a key railway linking the southern African nation’s copper region to a port on the Indian Ocean, in a ceremony that marked the first visit by a Chinese premier to the country in almost three decades.
title: China Starts $1.4 Billion Revamp of Mao-Era African Railway

author: Alastair Gale, Ryotaro Nakamaru
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi rebuffed demands from China to retract her recent comments about Taiwan, saying there was no change to Tokyo’s stance on how it would respond to a major regional security crisis.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Rejects China Demand to Retract Taiwan Remarks

author: Philip Aldrick, Alice Gledhill
description: When Keir Starmer’s office caught wind of a plot to oust him as prime minister, his Chancellor Rachel Reeves was basking in a rare bit of good news.
title: UK Budget Leaves Rachel Reeves Facing a £30 Billion Reckoning

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: Eric Swalwell, one of President Donald Trump’s fiercest Democratic critics in Congress, is launching a campaign for California governor in a bid to use his clashes with the White House to vault past a crowded field of candidates.
title: Swalwell Enters California Governor Race Taking Aim at Trump

author: Ishika Mookerjee
description: Artificial intelligence, the US-China rivalry, and the conflicts in Ukraine and Gaza were among key topics on the third and final day of the Bloomberg New Economy Forum. Here are the key takeaways:
title: Gaza War, AI, US-China Dominate Last Day of New Economy Forum

author: Andras Gergely, Tugce Ozsoy
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s preparations for a financial-market meltdown are baffling investors who see little signs of a looming collapse in one of the world’s best-performing emerging markets.
title: Orban Is Preparing for a Crisis and Investors Are Wondering Why

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto has assigned his vice president to attend the Group of 20 summit in South Africa in his stead, adding to a list of heads of state skipping the conference.
title: Indonesia Vice President to Attend G-20 Summit in Prabowo’s Stead

author: Robert Burnson
description: The prosecutor hand-picked by President Donald Trump to pursue a criminal case against James Comey now says the indictment of the former FBI director was properly presented to a grand jury for a vote — a day after telling a judge the final version of the charging papers was never shown to the full jury.
title: DOJ Reverses Itself, Says Comey Grand Jury Saw Final Indictment

author: Philip Heijmans
description: The ceasefire between Israel and Hamas is holding even if the situation remains fragile, US Ambassador to the United Nations Mike Waltz said in defense of a US-backed peace plan amid continued violence in Gaza.
title: Waltz Defends Gaza Peace Plan Despite Israeli Airstrikes

author: Dan Strumpf, Faseeh Mangi, Tooba Khan
description: Standing before US-based Pakistanis in June at a dinner in Washington, Asim Munir beamed after meeting US President Donald Trump in the Oval Office.
title: Trump Puts Pakistan Back on World Stage as Ties With India Fray

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Plunder, graft and bribery charges were recommended against Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s cousin for his alleged involvement in a corruption scandal.
title: Plunder Charge Sought Against Marcos Cousin in Philippine Corruption Scandal

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: Oklahoma Governor Kevin Stitt said he would be “reluctant” to welcome Chinese-owned business ventures into his state, another indication of how US-China tensions have reverberated across America’s local politics.
title: Oklahoma Governor ‘Reluctant’ to Host Chinese Ventures in State

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan should leverage its alliance with the US to counter China’s threats rather than seeking quick compromises alone that will lead to long-term losses, according to an outspoken Japanese lawmaker whose entry into China has been banned.
title: Japan Should Counter China Threats With US Help, Lawmaker Says

author: Swati Pandey
description: Singapore expects economic activity to cool in 2026 as US tariffs weigh on global demand, after nearly doubling estimates for this year to around 4% on the back of a strong third-quarter.
title: Singapore Sees Slower 2026 After Robust Year Against Tariffs
